input: Mrs. Gordon's class studies maple trees. Which property can the students measure with a meter stick?
A statue and a table are both made of the same type of marble. Which of the following properties will most likely be the same for both of these objects?

Currently, Antarctica is the coldest and driest place on Earth. Paleontologists have found dinosaur fossils in rock layers below the ice. Based on this evidence, which is a reasonable conclusion about the climate of Antarctica in the past?
output: At some time in the past, Antarctica was much warmer and wetter.
options: Antarctica has always had the same climate as at present.
At some time in the past, Antarctica was a hot, dry desert.
At some time in the past, Antarctica was much warmer and wetter.
At some time in the past, Antarctica was colder and wetter than it is now.

input: Constructive forces build a new mountain range. How will weathering and erosion change the features of the mountain range over time?
output: rounding the shapes of the rocks
options: folding the layers of the rocks
rounding the shapes of the rocks
